Legal_Issue: Duty to notify applicants of changed assessment criteria
Governing_Law: Administrative law principles of procedural fairness
Application_Facts: Kazi's application was assessed under new legislation without notification
Decision_Outcome: Original decision set aside; reconsideration ordered with proper notice
Defendant_Behavior: Assessed application under new rules without notice
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of notice and opportunity to respond
Assessment_Factor: Change in legislative criteria affecting application
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide notice and opportunity to submit additional information
Evidence_Used: Court record of visa officer’s decision process
Legal_Provision_Cited: Principles of procedural fairness under administrative law
Application_Basis: Visa application assessed under new legal framework
Evidence_Assessed: Timing and communication regarding legislative changes
Relief_Sought: Reconsideration of visa application with fair procedure
Governing_Rule: Officials must notify applicants of material changes and allow response time
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No evidence of notification to applicant about new criteria
Outcome: Judicial review allowed in part; decision remitted for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Applicant denied opportunity to tailor submission to new requirements
Cause_Description: Kazi’s application was rejected under new immigration rules without prior notice or chance to adapt his submission
Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed procedural steps taken by visa officer
Legal_Provision_Violated: Implied duty of procedural fairness in administrative decisions
Evidence_Issues: Absence of documentation showing notification to applicant
Evidence_Assessment: Court determined lack of notice constituted unfair process
Decision_Rationale: Decision made without affording applicant basic procedural rights
Decision_Making_Body: Visa officer, subject to Federal Court review
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to document or demonstrate provision of notice
